title: [JIT] tracing calls compileSpec() twice
body_html:
🐛 Bug

Code to reproduce:

Python script

import torch

def foo(x, y):
  return 2*x + y

traced_foo = torch.jit.trace(foo, (torch.rand(3).cuda(), torch.rand(3).cuda()))

Modification to master (I refreshed to current master just a moment ago)

ExecutionPlan compileSpec(const ArgumentSpec & spec) {
    std::cout << "graph_executor.cpp compileSpec()" << std::endl;

Running script results in

graph_executor.cpp compileSpec()
graph_executor.cpp compileSpec()

Calling compileSpec() twice seems unnecessary.

@apaszke who I was discussing this with.

body:
## 🐛 Bug

Code to reproduce:

Python script
```
import torch

def foo(x, y):
  return 2*x + y

traced_foo = torch.jit.trace(foo, (torch.rand(3).cuda(), torch.rand(3).cuda()))
```

Modification to master (I refreshed to current master just a moment ago)
```
ExecutionPlan compileSpec(const ArgumentSpec & spec) {
    std::cout << "graph_executor.cpp compileSpec()" << std::endl;
```

Running script results in 

```
graph_executor.cpp compileSpec()
graph_executor.cpp compileSpec()
```

Calling compileSpec() twice seems unnecessary.

@apaszke who I was discussing this with.
